III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 02/27/2025, a staff member started yelling at a youth as they
exited the gym and punched the youth in the stomach. The youth
was not seen by a medical professional following this incident.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed by phone on 02/28/2025.
Complainant did not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed at Wolverine Center on 03/04/2025.
Youth A stated he was walking out of the gym to get some air
when Staff 1 called his name. Youth A stated he walked past Staff
1 in the gymnasium’s video camera blind spot by the main door
and Staff 1 said, “What the fuck are you doing?” and punched
Youth A’s left side one time. Youth A stated he asked Staff 1 why
he punched him. Youth A stated Staff 1 told him the punch was for
Youth A not telling anyone he was going out for air. Youth A
stated Youth B was the only witness to this incident. Youth A
stated he told Staff 2 about the incident because Staff 2 found him
crying in the front of the main building. Youth A stated he then told
Therapist about the incident and was sent to the hospital for an
evaluation. Youth A stated the punch did not result in a mark or
bruise on his body. Youth A stated this is the only time Staff 1
punched him.
Youth B was interviewed at Wolverine Center on 03/06/2025 with
another Department of Health and Human Service Worker
(DHHS) Worker. Youth B stated the youths often go to the
gymnasium located behind the main building. Youth B stated
Youth A left the gymnasium angry and walked to the front of the
main building. Youth B stated he did not recall anything between
Youth A and Staff 1 except Staff 1 saying “Don’t make allegations
2

because it is not true” to Youth A. Youth B stated he feels safe at
Wolverine Center and does not have concerns. Youth B was
asked to describe his relationship with Staff 1. Youth B stated he
and Staff 1 are “fellow big backs”, which means they are friendly,
big guys that like to eat.
Staff 1 was interviewed at Wolverine Center on 03/06/2025 with
another DHHS Worker. Staff 1 stated he asked, “Where are you
going?” when Youth A attempted to walk out of the gym. Staff 1
stated Youth A responded with profanity and said, “Leave me the
fuck alone.” Staff 1 stated Staff 2 approached and followed Youth
A out of the gym. Staff 1 stated Staff 2 returned to the gym without
Youth A and told him that Youth A alleged Staff 1 hit him.
Staff 2 was interviewed at Wolverine Center on 03/06/2025 with
another DHHS Worker. Staff 2 stated he was at the opposite end
of the gymnasium from the gymnasium door when he gave Youth
A permission to use the bathroom, which is located by the main
door. Staff 2 stated he looked for Youth A when he did not return.
Staff 2 stated he asked Staff 1 and Staff 1 told him that Youth A
just walked out the door. Staff 2 stated he stepped outside and
followed Youth A to the front of the main building. Staff 2 stated
Youth A was upset and alleged Staff 1 punched him on the side
for leaving the gymnasium and asked to speak with Supervisor.
Staff 2 stated he took Youth A inside the main building and Youth
A spoke with Supervisor. Staff 2 stated Youth A did not complain
of pain or injury.
Supervisor was interviewed at Wolverine Center on 03/06/2025
with another DHHS Worker. Supervisor stated she met with Youth
A when a staff (does not recall who) requested it. Supervisor
stated Youth A told her that Staff 1 punched his chest where no
cameras are in the gymnasium. Supervisor stated she offered
Youth A a grievance and completed a safety plan for Staff 1 not to
work with Youth A pending investigation. Supervisor stated she
told Youth A that she would check the camera in case the incident
was caught on video tape. Supervisor stated Youth A then alleged
Staff 1 pushed him and was not punched. Supervisor stated she
notified Therapist of the incident and Youth A was sent out to the
hospital for an evaluation.
Therapist was interviewed by phone on 02/28/2024. Therapist
stated she met with Youth A and received Youth A’s grievance
about Staff 1 punching him on the side of his torso. Therapist
stated Youth A did not complain of pain and Therapist did not see
3

marks or swelling on the side of Youth A’s torso. Therapist stated
Youth A was sent to the hospital for an evaluation.
Video
Supervisor stated Youth A is correct that the video camera does
not capture the area by the gymnasium entrance door.
Documentation
Therapist wrote a behavior notification report dated 02/27/2025.
She wrote Youth A stated Staff 1 yelled and then punched Youth
A’s side by his stomach in the blind spot in the gymnasium foyer
when Youth A was walking out of the gymnasium for fresh air.
Therapist wrote Youth A did not report pain but was evaluated at a
local emergency department. Body chart on the behavior
notification states marks and bruises are not noted.
Corewell Health after visit summary dated 02/27/2025 diagnosed
Youth A with a possible contusion. Youth A was not prescribed
medication or follow up.
Youth A wrote a grievance dated 02/27/2025. It states Youth A
“walked to the blind spot” in the gymnasium and Staff 1 started to
yell at him and punched Youth A’s side. Youth A stated he walked
out of the gymnasium and let staff know.
Gymnasium Description
Gymnasium is located in a separate building behind Wolverine
Center’s main building. Upon entering the building, one steps into
a large gymnasium. There is a staff training and multipurpose
room to the left on the second floor and bathrooms are to the right.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as there is not enough
information to support a rule violation that Staff 1 punched Youth
A on the side of his torso. There is no video footage and Youth A
denied marks or bruising from the incident. Youth A was sent to
the hospital for an evaluation that resulted in a diagnosis of a
possible contusion.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
